issue.title: Output Extrinsics Data form SFM Reconstruction
issue.body:
Hi, thank you for sharing the amazing library with us and everything you have done. 
I wonder if it is possible to get all the extrinsic matrix with all the input pictures in the final sfm_data.bin? (Since I have thirty input images and I want to get each image's extrinsic matrix in my sfm_data.bin)  
I am new in this field and sorry for my basic question.
Thank you so much again.

Sincerely,
Edwin

comment.body:
It also worked for me and I truly appreciate all your help on this matter. Further to this question, there is an idea occurred to me, if combine different feature extraction methods will help to improve the situation when the object is somehow a bit featureless? Or it may not be so helpful due to the object's featureless feature? Sorry for the question that may not be so related to the software now.
And thank you so much for everything you have done again.

Sincerely,
Edwin

issue.title: Is it possible to get specific points from all data?
issue.body:
Hello everyone,

Im pretty new to SFM and just started to work with openMVG, so I can only hope my questions wont be too stupid :)

So here is the question: is it possible to get specific points and their coordinates from all cloud by their attributes? For example I need to find position of all green (or whatever color may be) balls on a picture. Is it possible to find points and coordinates of this balls from all points?

comment.body:
Oh thanks, thats a lot for the info!

I hope Ill find time to seriously get on it this weekend and try this tutorial, mb I ll find ways to improve it for new folks :) 
Btw I already found a way how to improve your installation guide, since there was some info that I needed to look for outside so I made myself small step-by-step instruction in text file how to install it from 0 (literall ground where you need to install VS first lol) if ill need this later again. I can share it later if you want.

Anyway, thanks again, I think my questions are far from its end but Ill start working and get back if I ll stuck :)

issue.title: No cloud data in cloud_and_poses.ply
issue.body:
1.cloud and poses.ply  file appears empty in meshlab. 
2.the same situation occurs in the my_trajectory.ply file.when I export camera pose  in meshlab. I get an odd number after the comma(GPS coordinate). my rotations data also looks zero. 
3.What does the data beginning with zero mean(data in the first and third row?)? 
![Screenshot from 2020-02-01 14-30-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59357057/73591420-66301d80-44ff-11ea-928f-18df56e667eb.png)
![Screenshot_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/59357057/73593225-ad73d980-4512-11ea-9129-72115547100f.png)

comment.body:
by making i run the same toolchain without -P , Then run 

> openMVG_main_geodesy_registration_to_gps_position


```
openMVG_main_SfMInit_ImageListing -d /sensor_width_camera_database.txt   -i /images/           -o matches -c 1  -f 2024.006827557486

openMVG_main_ComputeFeatures  -i /sfm_data.json  -o / -n 4 

openMVG_main_ComputeMatches  -i /sfm_data.json  -o matches/ -g e -f 1 -n ANNL2

-openMVG_main_GlobalSfM -i /matches/sfm_data.json -m /matches/ -o /out_global

openMVG_main_GlobalSfM -i sfm_data.json -m /matches/   -o out_global/

openMVG_main_ConvertSfM_DataFormat -i out_global/sfm_data.bin   -o my_trajectory.ply -E

openMVG_main_geodesy_registration_to_gps_position -i /sfm_data.bin   -o sfm_data_adjusted.bin

openMVG_main_ConvertSfM_DataFormat -i /sfm_data_adjusted.bin   -o /my_trajectory.ply -E
```

my image files [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1FeRkqtzGFJs1kfF8bBRShb_eBKkeIgwp](url)

matches file  [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1N57QGZhGRzacFt_V3Lb-c1DK3R4Ssc5V](url)

out file  [https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Og3X6ICWHZ-yaJpj9-Sz9fS6NnS2D6Ai](url)

issue.title: Is it possible to get specific points from all data?
issue.body:
Hello everyone,

Im pretty new to SFM and just started to work with openMVG, so I can only hope my questions wont be too stupid :)

So here is the question: is it possible to get specific points and their coordinates from all cloud by their attributes? For example I need to find position of all green (or whatever color may be) balls on a picture. Is it possible to find points and coordinates of this balls from all points?

comment.body:
OpenMVG does not provide a GUI ye because we think that makes people manipulate the concept helps them better understand what matters in photogrammetry (camera calibration, features, matching and then SfM).

To make usage easier we provide python scripts that are launching the toolchain.
We have recently introduced a wiki, it would be nice to have your feedback on it ;-)
https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG/wiki/OpenMVG-on-your-image-dataset

For your Balls you could also use the GCP feature with some small modification, click by hand the corresponding points and ask the binary to triangulate them... https://openmvg.readthedocs.io/en/latest/software/ui/SfM/control_points_registration/GCP/

Automating the detection of the green blob and their correspondences would be nice, since after you would just have to call triangulation

comment.body: Point cloud data PLY can be opened with Meshlab or CloudCompare.

issue.title: How to add my own features to openMVG?
issue.body:
I have a photogrammetric system which calculates distance between points on image. The system based on artificial features. I can get openMVGs features due to openMVG_main_exportKeypoints, but how can I add my features to openMVG before compute matches?

What is structure of openMVGs features?  How can I push my features to openMVGs features?
I just want to edit *.feat but it's binary, so I should load data, add my features and  back to openMVG.

comment.body:
Thank you for your answer and link. I will try to use OpenMVG API.
I want to add 3d model for result of a photogrammetric system, becouse now I have only photos with points and distance between them. I want to see this in 3d.

comment.body:
How does the dataset react if you do first SfM without GPS and then do the geo-registration.
-> Basically run the same toolchain without `-P`
-> Then run `openMVG_main_geodesy_registration_to_gps_position` -> https://openmvg.readthedocs.io/en/latest/software/Geodesy/geodesy/#rigid-registration-sfm

We need to understand if the view-graph is dense enough for SfM.

issue.title: how to insert GPS data of the cameras to generate a real 3D model
issue.body: As I know ,the software meshroom is using this opensource,but it does not support GPS data.Can I insert the position data of cameras to generate some point cloud data and then we can use meshroom or another software to generate meshmodel?

comment.body: Or else you use OpenMVG+OpenMVS, OpenMVS results will be as good as meshroom output

issue.title: how to insert GPS data of the cameras to generate a real 3D model
issue.body: As I know ,the software meshroom is using this opensource,but it does not support GPS data.Can I insert the position data of cameras to generate some point cloud data and then we can use meshroom or another software to generate meshmodel?

comment.body:
There is no interoperability between meshroom and openMVG.
Meshroom/AliceVision chooses to update the sfm_data class and did not keep any conversion tool so there is no backward compatibility.

But, I think you can manage to do with some manual work by using ConvertSfmDataFormat (bin -> json), copy the poses data from openMVG's sfm_data to Meshroom sfm_data and then recompute the 3D structure in Meshroom (ComputeStructureFromKnownPoses).

issue.title: How to add my own features to openMVG?
issue.body:
I have a photogrammetric system which calculates distance between points on image. The system based on artificial features. I can get openMVGs features due to openMVG_main_exportKeypoints, but how can I add my features to openMVG before compute matches?

What is structure of openMVGs features?  How can I push my features to openMVGs features?
I just want to edit *.feat but it's binary, so I should load data, add my features and  back to openMVG.

comment.body:
I would recommend you to use OpenMVG API.
So use the existing OpenMVG data structure and IO API to log your feature in OpenMVG format.
You can see here the addition of features and descriptors to regions https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG/blob/develop/src/openMVG/features/sift/SIFT_Anatomy_Image_Describer.hpp#L194

Or, you can load the SIFT computed features and append your own ones.

Can you elaborate exactly what you want to do:
- do you want to calibrate a scene (recover the camera position) and then triangulate some points that you knew the positions in the images and their correspondences?
- or do you want to do something different?

issue.title: Output Extrinsics Data form SFM Reconstruction
issue.body:
Hi, thank you for sharing the amazing library with us and everything you have done. 
I wonder if it is possible to get all the extrinsic matrix with all the input pictures in the final sfm_data.bin? (Since I have thirty input images and I want to get each image's extrinsic matrix in my sfm_data.bin)  
I am new in this field and sorry for my basic question.
Thank you so much again.

Sincerely,
Edwin

comment.body:
Lego blocks are somehow a bit "featureless".

Here what you can try:

Command lines option:
- Option `-p HIGH` on ComputeFeatures to detect more points per images
- Use option `-n ANNL2` on COmputeMatches to have more accurate matches
- Use option `'-n 8` on ComputeFeatures to use 8 thread to compute the Features (faster)

-> It worked for me
```
-------------------------------
-- Structure from Motion (statistics):
-- #Camera calibrated: 29 from 29 input images.
-- #Tracks, #3D points: 19511
-------------------------------
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3235050/74275757-52d43d80-4cc9-11ea-95fd-dbe25314b1e9.png)

-> As you can see there are very few points on the LEGO structure, most of the points are on the ground.

One side of the object seems capture with more sharpness:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3235050/74275855-8020eb80-4cc9-11ea-915f-a467f965af32.png)


Image capture tricks:
- Take your pictures with a tripod (some images are blurry)
- Add a newspaper page under your object to bring more features to the scene

comment.body:
@sealiutree7 Did you look to the log of the SfM process?
- It seems that all the camera has not been localized.
You should have a log telling the number of views and poses at the end of the process.

We are willing to help to see what's going on with your dataset. It could be that not enough matches are shared between the images, or could be something else.

issue.title: Output Extrinsics Data form SFM Reconstruction
issue.body:
Hi, thank you for sharing the amazing library with us and everything you have done. 
I wonder if it is possible to get all the extrinsic matrix with all the input pictures in the final sfm_data.bin? (Since I have thirty input images and I want to get each image's extrinsic matrix in my sfm_data.bin)

comment.body:
Thank you for your reply and your time deeply. Because when I got my final sfm output, I only  got a part of the extrinsic matrix correspond to the input images. 
For example, if I have thirty input images,
in sfm_data.json (the file converted from sfm_data.bin used the funtion "openMVG_main_ConvertSfM_DataFormat"
) the _"views"_ will have 30 _"key"_ which count from _"key": 0_ to "_key": 29_.
However, the "extrinsics" may only have "_key": 0_ to _"key": 4_ and "_key": 18_ to _"key": 29_ which loss the data from "_key": 5_ to _"key": 17_, and this cause loss some of the extrinsic matrix correspond to the input images.  I wonder whether is there a method can force to produce all the extrinsic matrix correspond to the input images in the final sfm data?
Thank you so much for your help again.

Sincerely,
Edwin

Thank you so much again.

Sincerely,
Edwin

comment.body:
Using `openMVG_main_ConvertSfM_DataFormat`, you can convert the sfm_data between the following formats: .json, .bin, .xml, .ply, .baf

JSON is probably your best bet if you're using a language like Python.

issue.title: Is it possible to get specific points from all data?
issue.body:
Hello everyone,

Im pretty new to SFM and just started to work with openMVG, so I can only hope my questions wont be too stupid :)

So here is the question: is it possible to get specific points and their coordinates from all cloud by their attributes? For example I need to find position of all green (or whatever color may be) balls on a picture. Is it possible to find points and coordinates of this balls from all points?

comment.body:
Don't be silly, the only stupid question is the one that doesn't get asked.

You can get the camera poses and the features from the sfm_data.json that get's generated. I believe the green dots are the camera poses. If your reconstruction is generating a sfm_data.bin file, you can convert it to json or xml using `openMVG_main_ConvertSfM_DataFormat`

https://openmvg.readthedocs.io/en/latest/software/SfM/SfM_OutputFormat/
